chargeHist.descr: Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater

result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward Greengrass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Edward Greengrass is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Edward Greengrass was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED AND STAYED. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Concur to Dane Co Case 21CF791. Parties are given 2 weeks to file any sentence credit. If nothing is filed, zero days will remain.
Concurrent with: Dane Co case 21CF791

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $192 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with LM. Subject to change with Agent approval.
Completion of certified/DOC domestic violence treatment. DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
